result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Steger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to continue with all recommended mental health treatment
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Steger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:35am. 
Defendant James M Steger in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Repeater finding made.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Steger on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to continue with all recommended mental health treatment
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess 9:57am.

[MK] case called at 2:47pm. 
Defendant James M Steger in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 2:48pm.


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 11:20am   (2)  Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 9:30am
